problem_description:
Global problem:
    This problem involves a collection of items, where each have a value and a weight. We have different items given in the parameters.
    We have a infinite number of boxes with width BOX_WIDTH and height BOX_HEIGHT. All items need to be packed into minimal number of such boxes.
    The result and expected output is:
        - the assigment of each item into a box
        - the position (x and y) of each item within its assigned box. x and y have minimum values 0 and maximum infinity.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 1:
    The items that are put into a box, must fit exactly inside the box and must not stick out of the box.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 2:
    Taking the given items that are put into a box, they must not overlap.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 3:
    Taking the given items that are put into a box, one item can be exactly in one box.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

constants.description: List of items with their dimensions

decision_variables.description: Number of boxes used in the end to pack all all items. Minimizing it is the objective.
Which item is assigned to which box as a separate variable.
Position x and y of each item within box as a separate variable.

constraints:
# -- Constraints --


# --- Auxiliary Variables ---
# Leave empty, if not required.
# --- constraints ---
def fit_items_in_boxes(
    items: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Item),
    assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=BoxAssignment),
    box_width: int,
    box_height: int
):
    for i in range(1, 21):
        # Item must fit within the box dimensions
        assert assignments[i].x + items[i].width <= box_width
        assert assignments[i].y + items[i].height <= box_height
        # Positions must be non-negative (already constrained by Field, so omitted)
        # Box index must be positive (already constrained by Field, so omitted)

fit_items_in_boxes(ITEMS, item_box_assignments, BOX_WIDTH, BOX_HEIGHT)

# Ensure x_y_positions matches item_box_assignments
for i in range(1, 21):
    assert x_y_positions[i].box_index == item_box_assignments[i].box_index
    assert x_y_positions[i].x == item_box_assignments[i].x
    assert x_y_positions[i].y == item_box_assignments[i].y

# --- Auxiliary Variables ---
# Leave empty, if not required.
# --- constraints ---
def no_overlap(
    assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=BoxAssignment),
    items: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Item)
):
    for i in range(1, 21):
        for j in range(i + 1, 21):
            # Only check overlap if both items are in the same box
            if assignments[i].box_index == assignments[j].box_index:
                # Check if rectangles (items) overlap
                # Conditions for non-overlapping:
                # item i is to the right of item j: assignments[i].x >= assignments[j].x + items[j].width
                # item i is to the left of item j: assignments[j].x >= assignments[i].x + items[i].width
                # item i is below item j: assignments[i].y >= assignments[j].y + items[j].height
                # item i is above item j: assignments[j].y >= assignments[i].y + items[i].height
                # If none of these conditions hold, there's an overlap.
                # So, we assert that at least one of these conditions must be true to avoid overlap.
                assert (
                    assignments[i].x >= assignments[j].x + items[j].width or
                    assignments[j].x >= assignments[i].x + items[i].width or
                    assignments[i].y >= assignments[j].y + items[j].height or
                    assignments[j].y >= assignments[i].y + items[i].height
                )

no_overlap(item_box_assignments, ITEMS)

# --- Auxiliary Variables ---
# Leave empty, if not required.
# --- constraints ---
def ensure_item_assignment_consistency(
    assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=BoxAssignment),
    positions: DSList(length=20, elem_type=BoxAssignment)
):
    for i in range(1, 21):
        assert assignments[i].box_index == positions[i].box_index
        assert assignments[i].x == positions[i].x
        assert assignments[i].y == positions[i].y

ensure_item_assignment_consistency(item_box_assignments, x_y_positions)
full_formulation:
# --- Objects ---


# Object type for items with width and height
Item = DSRecord({
    "width": DSInt(lb=1, ub=10),
    "height": DSInt(lb=1, ub=10)
})

# Object type for box assignments with box index and positions
BoxAssignment = DSRecord({
    "box_index": DSInt(lb=1, ub=20),
    "x": DSInt(lb=0, ub=10),
    "y": DSInt(lb=0, ub=10)
})



# --- Constants and Decision Variables ---
BOX_HEIGHT : int = 10
BOX_WIDTH : int = 10
ITEMS : DSList(length=20, elem_type=Item) = [{"width": 10, "height": 4}, {"width": 2, "height": 10}, {"width": 2, "height": 4}, {"width": 10, "height": 10}, {"width": 7, "height": 2}, {"width": 9, "height": 10}, {"width": 5, "height": 6}, {"width": 7, "height": 5}, {"width": 1, "height": 7}, {"width": 5, "height": 3}, {"width": 3, "height": 9}, {"width": 9, "height": 4}, {"width": 2, "height": 10}, {"width": 4, "height": 3}, {"width": 2, "height": 2}, {"width": 4, "height": 9}, {"width": 2, "height": 8}, {"width": 1, "height": 1}, {"width": 1, "height": 7}, {"width": 4, "height": 4}]
N_ITEMS : int = 20
nr_used_boxes : DSInt(lb=1, ub=20)
item_box_assignments : DSList(length=20, elem_type=BoxAssignment)
x_y_positions : DSList(length=20, elem_type=BoxAssignment)
N_ITEMS : int = 20
N_ITEM_BOX_ASSIGNMENTS : int = 20
N_X_Y_POSITIONS : int = 20


# --- objective ---
def calculate_objective(assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=BoxAssignment)) -> DSInt(lb=1, ub=20):
    max_box_index: int = 0
    for i in range(1, 21):
        if assignments[i].box_index > max_box_index:
            max_box_index = assignments[i].box_index
    return max_box_index

objective = calculate_objective(item_box_assignments)
nr_used_boxes = objective
minimize(objective)

    items: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Item),
    assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=BoxAssignment),
    box_width: int,
    box_height: int
):
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        for j in range(i + 1, N_ITEMS + 1):
            # Check if items i and j are in the same box
            if assignments[i].box_index == assignments[j].box_index:
                # Check for non-overlapping in x-direction
                x_non_overlap: bool = (assignments[i].x + items[i].width <= assignments[j].x) or \
                                      (assignments[j].x + items[j].width <= assignments[i].x)
                # Check for non-overlapping in y-direction
                y_non_overlap: bool = (assignments[i].y + items[i].height <= assignments[j].y) or \
                                      (assignments[j].y + items[j].height <= assignments[i].y)
                # Ensure at least one direction does not overlap
                assert x_non_overlap or y_non_overlap

no_overlap_constraints(ITEMS, item_box_assignments, BOX_WIDTH, BOX_HEIGHT)

# Set redundant fields equal
for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
    assert item_box_assignments[i].box_index == x_y_positions[i].box_index
    assert item_box_assignments[i].x == x_y_positions[i].x
    assert item_box_assignments[i].y == x_y_positions[i].y

    max_boxes: int
):
    for i in range(1, 21):
        # Each item must be assigned to a valid box index
        assert assignments[i].box_index >= 1
        assert assignments[i].box_index <= max_boxes

ensure_item_box_assignment_validity(item_box_assignments, N_ITEMS, 20)

):

        assert assignments[i].y + items[i].height <= box_height
        # Ensure item is placed within valid box boundaries

        assert assignments[i].y >= 0

):
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):

            # Check if items i and j are in the same box
            if assignments[i].box_index == assignments[j].box_index:
                # Check for non-overlapping in x-direction
                x_non_overlap: bool = (assignments[i].x + items[i].width <= assignments[j].x) or \
                                      (assignments[j].x + items[j].width <= assignments[i].x)
                # Check for non-overlapping in y-direction
                y_non_overlap: bool = (assignments[i].y + items[i].height <= assignments[j].y) or \
                                      (assignments[j].y + items[j].height <= assignments[i].y)
                # Ensure at least one direction does not overlap
                assert x_non_overlap or y_non_overlap

problem_description:
Global problem:
    This problem involves a collection of items, where each have a value and a weight. We have different items given in the parameters.
    We have a infinite number of boxes with width BOX_WIDTH and height BOX_HEIGHT. All items need to be packed into minimal number of such boxes.
    The result and expected output is:
        - the assigment of each item into a box
        - the position (x and y) of each item within its assigned box. x and y have minimum values 0 and maximum infinity.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 1:
    The items that are put into a box, must fit exactly inside the box and must not stick out of the box.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 2:
    Taking the given items that are put into a box, they must not overlap.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 3:
    Taking the given items that are put into a box, one item can be exactly in one box.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

constants.description: List of items with their dimensions

decision_variables.description: Number of boxes used in the end to pack all all items. Minimizing it is the objective.
Which item is assigned to which box as a separate variable.
Position x and y of each item within box as a separate variable.

# --- objective ---
def calculate_objective(assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=BoxAssignment)) -> DSInt(lb=1, ub=20):
    max_box_index: int = 0
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        box_idx: int = assignments[i].box_index
        if box_idx > max_box_index:
            max_box_index = box_idx
    return max_box_index

objective = calculate_objective(item_box_assignments)
nr_used_boxes = objective
minimize(objective)

def ensure_items_fit_in_boxes(
    items: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Item),
    positions: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Position),
    assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=20))
) -> None:
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        item_right_edge: int = positions[i].x + items[i].width
        item_bottom_edge: int = positions[i].y + items[i].height
        assert positions[i].x >= 0
        assert positions[i].y >= 0
        assert item_right_edge <= BOX_WIDTH
        assert item_bottom_edge <= BOX_HEIGHT

ensure_items_fit_in_boxes(ITEMS, x_y_positions, item_box_assignments)

# --- Auxiliary Variables ---
# Leave empty, if not required.
# --- constraints ---
def prevent_item_overlap(
    items: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Item),
    positions: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Position),
    assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=20))
) -> None:
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        for j in range(i + 1, N_ITEMS + 1):
            # Only check overlap if both items are in the same box
            if assignments[i] == assignments[j]:
                # Calculate edges for item i
                i_right: int = positions[i].x + items[i].width
                i_bottom: int = positions[i].y + items[i].height
                
                # Calculate edges for item j
                j_right: int = positions[j].x + items[j].width
                j_bottom: int = positions[j].y + items[j].height
                
                # Assert that the items do not overlap
                # Overlap occurs if both rectangles intersect in both x and y dimensions
                assert not (
                    positions[i].x < j_right and
                    i_right > positions[j].x and
                    positions[i].y < j_bottom and
                    i_bottom > positions[j].y
                )

def prevent_item_overlap(
    items: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Item),
    positions: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Position),
    assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=20))
) -> None:
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        for j in range(i + 1, N_ITEMS + 1):
            # Only check overlap if both items are in the same box
            if assignments[i] == assignments[j]:
                # Calculate edges for item i
                i_right: int = positions[i].x + items[i].width
                i_bottom: int = positions[i].y + items[i].height
                
                # Calculate edges for item j
                j_right: int = positions[j].x + items[j].width
                j_bottom: int = positions[j].y + items[j].height
                
                # Assert that the items do not overlap
                # Overlap occurs if both rectangles intersect in both x and y dimensions
                assert not (
                    positions[i].x < j_right and
                    i_right > positions[j].x and
                    positions[i].y < j_bottom and
                    i_bottom > positions[j].y
                )

problem_description:
Global problem:
    This problem involves a collection of items, where each have a value and a weight. We have different items given in the parameters.
    We have a infinite number of boxes with width BOX_WIDTH and height BOX_HEIGHT. All items need to be packed into minimal number of such boxes.
    The result and expected output is:
        - the assigment of each item into a box
        - the position (x and y) of each item within its assigned box. x and y have minimum values 0 and maximum infinity.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 1:
    The items that are put into a box, must fit exactly inside the box and must not stick out of the box.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 2:
    Taking the given items that are put into a box, they must not overlap.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 3:
    Taking the given items that are put into a box, one item can be exactly in one box.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

constants.description: List of items to be placed in the box

decision_variables.description: Number of boxes used in the end to pack all all items. Minimizing it is the objective.
Which item is assigned to which box as a separate variable.
decision_variables.initialization: item_box_assignments : Annotated[list[Annotated[int, Field(strict=True, ge=1, le=20)]], Len(20, 20)]

decision_variables.description: Position x and y of each item within box as a separate variable.

) -> None:
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        box_id: int = assignments[i]
        pos: Position = positions[i]
        item: Item = items[i]

        # Ensure item fits within the box dimensions
        assert pos.x + item.width <= BOX_WIDTH
        assert pos.y + item.height <= BOX_HEIGHT

        # Ensure item does not overlap with other items in the same box
        for j in range(i + 1, N_ITEMS + 1):
            if assignments[j] == box_id:
                other_pos: Position = positions[j]
                other_item: Item = items[j]

                # Check for non-overlapping rectangles
                assert (
                    pos.x + item.width <= other_pos.x or
                    other_pos.x + other_item.width <= pos.x or
                    pos.y + item.height <= other_pos.y or
                    other_pos.y + other_item.height <= pos.y
                )

problem_description:
Global problem:
    This problem involves a collection of items, where each have a value and a weight. We have different items given in the parameters.
    We have a infinite number of boxes with width BOX_WIDTH and height BOX_HEIGHT. All items need to be packed into minimal number of such boxes.
    The result and expected output is:
        - the assigment of each item into a box
        - the position (x and y) of each item within its assigned box. x and y have minimum values 0 and maximum infinity.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 1:
    The items that are put into a box, must fit exactly inside the box and must not stick out of the box.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 2:
    Taking the given items that are put into a box, they must not overlap.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 3:
    Taking the given items that are put into a box, one item can be exactly in one box.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

decision_variables.description: Number of boxes used in the end to pack all all items. Minimizing it is the objective.
Which item is assigned to which box as a separate variable.
decision_variables.initialization: item_box_assignments: Annotated[list[Annotated[int, Field(strict=True, ge=1, le=20)]], Len(20, 20)]

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 3:
    Taking the given items that are put into a box, one item can be exactly in one box.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

constants.description: List of items with their dimensions

decision_variables.description: Number of boxes used in the end to pack all all items. Minimizing it is the objective.
Which item is assigned to which box as a separate variable.
decision_variables.initialization: item_box_assignments: Annotated[list[Annotated[int, Field(strict=True, ge=1, le=20)]], Len(20, 20)]

decision_variables.description: Position x and y of each item within box as a separate variable.

objective:
# --- objective ---
def calculate_objective(item_box_assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=20))) -> int:
    max_box_index: int = 0
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        box_index: int = item_box_assignments[i]
        if box_index > max_box_index:
            max_box_index = box_index
    return max_box_index

objective = calculate_objective(item_box_assignments)
nr_used_boxes = objective
minimize(objective)
constraints:
# -- Constraints --


# --- Auxiliary Variables ---
# Leave empty, if not required.
# --- constraints ---
def ensure_items_fit_in_boxes(
    items: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Item),
    positions: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Position),
    box_assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=20))
) -> None:
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        item_width: int = items[i].width
        item_height: int = items[i].height
        pos_x: int = positions[i].x
        pos_y: int = positions[i].y
        box_idx: int = box_assignments[i]
        
        # Ensure item fits within the box dimensions
        assert pos_x + item_width <= BOX_WIDTH
        assert pos_y + item_height <= BOX_HEIGHT
        assert pos_x >= 0
        assert pos_y >= 0

ensure_items_fit_in_boxes(ITEMS, x_y_positions, item_box_assignments)

# --- constraints ---
def ensure_no_item_overlap(
    items: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Item),
    positions: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Position),
    box_assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=20))
) -> None:
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        for j in range(i + 1, N_ITEMS + 1):
            # Only check items in the same box
            if box_assignments[i] == box_assignments[j]:
                # Check if rectangles (items) overlap
                # They don't overlap if one is completely to the left, right, above, or below the other
                assert (
                    (positions[i].x + items[i].width <= positions[j].x) or
                    (positions[j].x + items[j].width <= positions[i].x) or
                    (positions[i].y + items[i].height <= positions[j].y) or
                    (positions[j].y + items[j].height <= positions[i].y)
                )

ensure_no_item_overlap(ITEMS, x_y_positions, item_box_assignments)

# --- Auxiliary Variables ---
# Leave empty, if not required.
# --- constraints ---
def ensure_item_box_assignment_validity(
    box_assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=20))
) -> None:
    # Each item must be assigned to exactly one box
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        assert box_assignments[i] >= 1
        assert box_assignments[i] <= 20

ensure_item_box_assignment_validity(item_box_assignments)
full_formulation:
# --- Objects ---


# Object type for an item with width and height
Item = DSRecord({
    "width": DSInt(lb=1, ub=10),
    "height": DSInt(lb=1, ub=10)
})

# Object type for the position (x, y) of an item within a box
Position = DSRecord({
    "x": DSInt(lb=0),
    "y": DSInt(lb=0)
})



# --- Constants and Decision Variables ---
BOX_HEIGHT : int = 10
BOX_WIDTH : int = 10
ITEMS : DSList(length=20, elem_type=Item) = [
    {"width": 10, "height": 4},
    {"width": 2, "height": 10},
    {"width": 2, "height": 4},
    {"width": 10, "height": 10},
    {"width": 7, "height": 2},
    {"width": 9, "height": 10},
    {"width": 5, "height": 6},
    {"width": 7, "height": 5},
    {"width": 1, "height": 7},
    {"width": 5, "height": 3},
    {"width": 3, "height": 9},
    {"width": 9, "height": 4},
    {"width": 2, "height": 10},
    {"width": 4, "height": 3},
    {"width": 2, "height": 2},
    {"width": 4, "height": 9},
    {"width": 2, "height": 8},
    {"width": 1, "height": 1},
    {"width": 1, "height": 7},
    {"width": 4, "height": 4}
]
N_ITEMS : int = 20
nr_used_boxes: DSInt(lb=0, ub=20)
item_box_assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=20))
x_y_positions: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Position)
N_ITEMS : int = 20
N_ITEM_BOX_ASSIGNMENTS : int = 20
N_X_Y_POSITIONS : int = 20


# --- objective ---
def calculate_objective(item_box_assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=20))) -> int:
    max_box_index: int = 0
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        box_index: int = item_box_assignments[i]
        if box_index > max_box_index:
            max_box_index = box_index
    return max_box_index

objective = calculate_objective(item_box_assignments)
nr_used_boxes = objective
minimize(objective)
